business.headline: Special Report: India's Economy Faces Trump Tariffs and Trade Impasse Entering 2026In this Special Report, an unidentified speaker analyses the state of the Indian economy as the nation steps into 2026. While highlighting a 'stupendous 2025' marked by major reforms like GST simplification and the Jan Vishwas Bill, the report warns that India enters the new year 'playing on a strong economic pitch, but also on a sticky wicket'. Key challenges identified include the ongoing trade impasse with the US, punitive 'Trump tariffs' of 50%, and a depreciating rupee which breached the 91 mark against the dollar. The programme notes that while GDP growth remains robust at 8%, high food inflation and sluggish job creation persist. With five state elections due in 2026, the report also flags concerns over rising state debts due to populist spending, even as all eyes turn to the upcoming Union Budget in February to restore confidence and boost private investment.

Commercial LPG cylinder price hiked by Rs 111 on New Year, highest since June 2025On New Year's Day, the price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by Rs 111 — the steepest hike in six months, — with effect from today. The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder, however, remains unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as ITC, Godfrey Phillipss crash on tobacco cess moveThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 32 points to close at 85,188.60, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 16.95 points to end at 26,146.55.

Silver vs gold vs stock vs real estate: What can deliver most gains in 2026Should it be gold, which has just seen its strongest year since 1979? Or silver, which has surged over 150%, marking one of its best-ever annual performances?

Inside draft labour code rules. What the fine print says on wages, working hoursThe draft Rules relate to the Code on Wages, the Code on Social Security, the Industrial Relations Code and the Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions.

ITC, Godfrey Phillips shares tank up to 16%: Why are tobacco shares falling todayShares of Godfrey Phillips India Ltd fell sharply in early trade, sliding nearly 16%. Shares of ITC Ltd also came under pressure, falling around 9% during early trade. The stock slipped to about Rs 362.70, touching its 52-week low.
Sensex opens 180 points higher, Nifty above 26,150; ITC down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 104.21 points to 85,324.81, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 28.60 points to 26,158.20 as of 9:25 am.

Stock market holiday today? Check if NSE and BSE are closed for New Year 2026Major international stock markets across China, Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore, France, Germany, the UAE, the UK and the US are closed on New Year's Day.

Extra excise duty on tobacco products, cess on pan masala to take effect February 1The new levies on tobacco and pan masala will be imposed over and above the applicable GST rates. These measures will replace the GST compensation cess, which is currently charged at varying rates on sin products.

Indraprastha Gas Limited reduces piped cooking gas prices in Delhi-NCRThe reduction follows the sector regulator Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board's (PNGRB) recent overhaul of pipeline tariffs.

Indian economy to clock strong growth despite global headwinds: RBI GovernorRBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said maintaining financial stability, resilient institutions and prudent regulation remains central to safeguarding the economy from external shocks.

Investment guru Warren Buffett retires today. What's his retirement fund?As Warren Buffett, the Oracle of Omaha, steps aside after turning Berkshire Hathaway into a $1.1 trillion conglomerate, questions turn to how the world's most famous investor will fund life after hanging his boots. With nearly all his $149 billion fortune tied up in Berkshire stock, Buffett's retirement corpus is built on long-term bets, compounding, and an empire he still controls.

Earning Rs 1 crore but can't afford a Rs 5 crore home in Gurgaon? Expert explains whyA Rs 1 crore annual salary sounds more than sufficient to buy a house. Yet, many high earners find themselves priced out of the housing market. Here's what an expert says about the real reasons behind this mismatch.

Holiday vs retirement home: How to decide the purpose of your second propertyMany buyers dream of a second home, but few pause to ask a key question: Is it meant for leisure or for life after work? The answer shapes everything from location and cost to comfort and long-term suitability. Let's have a look.
Sensex ends 545 points higher, Nifty above 26,100; RIL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 545.52 points to end at 85,220.60, while the NSE Nifty50 added 190.75 points to close at 26,129.60​​​​​​​.

Vodafone Idea gets more time to pay Rs 87,695 crore AGR duesAccording to sources, the AGR dues amounting to Rs 87,695 crore will now be paid over a ten-year period from FY32 to FY41. While the decision eases near-term repayment pressure, it does not involve any waiver, haircut, or reduction in the total dues.

Did New Year's Eve strike by Swiggy, Zomato riders hit customers across India?With platforms heavily dependent on delivery partners during year-end celebrations, there was uncertainty over how widely the strike would be observed.

Last day to file revised ITR: Follow these simple steps for quick processingToday is the final day for taxpayers to submit a revised Income Tax Return. If you have spotted any mistake in your earlier filing, following a few simple steps can help you complete the process quickly and smoothly.

Silver prices crash after record rally. What should investors do now?Silver futures on MCX are trading sharply lower near Rs 2,37,000–2,38,000 per kg, after closing at Rs 2,32,723 in the previous session. The decline reflects the steep correction in global prices.

Why mid-career professionals feel financially stretched after switching jobsMid-career executives usually fall into the age group of 35 – 45 depending on the industry or job roles they occupy. By this time, they have their children studying in schools, financial commitments like home and vehicle loans and, in many cases, ageing parents to look after.

entertainment.headline: Revised version of Akshaye Khanna's Dhurandhar hits cinemas today The espionage thriller Dhurandhar, directed by Aditya Dhar and starring Ranveer Singh, has released a revised version in cinemas nationwide after the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting ordered changes to certain dialogues and muted words due to political sensitivities.

Is Farhan Akhtar eyeing Rajat Bedi to replace Vikrant Massey in Don 3? Following the departure of several key actors from Farhan Akhtar's anticipated Don 3, discussions are underway with Rajat Bedi to fill a major role after Vikrant Massey's exit. Official confirmation is awaited as casting changes continue ahead of production.

Encouraging, myth-breaking: Trade experts decode 2025 box office, set sights on 2026 The past year broke box office myths, rewarding content and conviction over formula and star power, with films like 'Saiyaara', 'Lokah: Chapter 1' and 'Mahavatar Narsimha'. Experts speak to India Today about the audience-driven shift, along with a strong 2026 slate, promises an exciting future for Hindi cinema.

Abishan Jeevinth–Anaswara Rajan's With Love set for February 2026 release The Tamil romantic comedy, With Love,  starring Abishan Jeevinth and Anaswara Rajan, is set to release in theatres in February 2026. The film's modern take on young relationships is expected to resonate strongly with Gen Z audiences.

Arjun Sarja's Seetha Payanam set for Valentine's Day release, new poster out The makers of Seetha Payanam have confirmed the film will be released on Valentine's Day. Directed by Arjun Sarja, the film also marks the debut of Niranjan Sudhindra and Aishwarya Arjun in the Telugu space.

Prabhas' Spirit poster wins Bollywood: Katrina Kaif, Kiara Advani post early likes The first-look poster of Spirit, starring Prabhas and Tripti Dimri, has triggered a massive online reaction since its New Year's Eve release. Among those impressed are Bollywood stars including Katrina Kaif and Kiara Advani, among others

David Beckham sends love to Brooklyn after omitting him from 2025 family recap David Beckham sent love to his 26-year-old son Brooklyn after omitting him from 2025 family recap. Reports of a rift within the Beckham family surfaced after David and Victoria unfollowed Brooklyn on Instagram.

Ikkis in theatres: Sunny Deol honours Dharmendra's legacy with emotional message Dharmendra's last film, Ikkis, was released in cinemas on January 1. A day prior to its release, his son Sunny Deol shared a heartfelt note in remembrance of his father's career.

Happy New Year 2026: Allu Arjun, Vicky Kaushal, Kajol and others share warm wishes Actors Allu Arjun, Vicky Kaushal, Sidharth Malhotra, Kajol and others sent warm New Year greetings to their family and fans on social media.

Meet Riya Shibu of Sarvam Maya: At 21, she has produced more films than acted in Riya Shibu is impressing right now, for her role of the young ghost Delulu in the Malayalam supernatural fantasy comedy, Sarvam Maya, a film that has opened to critical and commercial success.

Demonte Colony 3: Arulnithi returns to face haunting forces, first look poster out The third instalment in the Demonte Colony horror-thriller series gears up for a summer 2026 release, with Arulnithi and key cast members returning. Siddhant Chaturvedi, Alizeh Agnihotri team up for Hindi remake of La Famille Belier Siddhant Chaturvedi and Alizeh Agnihotri have been cast in the Hindi adaptation of the French film La Famille Belier, with Vikas Bahl directing. The musical drama, inspired by both the original and its Oscar-winning remake CODA, will explore themes of family responsibility and personal aspiration.

Pawan Kalyan reverses no-cinema decision, announces new film with Surender Reddy Pawan Kalyan has announced his next film, confirming a collaboration with director Surender Reddy. The Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister was last seen in the superhit, They Call Him OG, last year.

Haq OTT release: When and where to watch Yami Gautam Dhar-Emraan Hashmi's film Yami Gautam Dhar and Emraan Hashmi's legal drama Haq is all set for its OTT release. The film, directed by Suparn Varma is based on the 1985 landmark Supreme Court judgment involving Shah Bano Begum.

Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli welcome New Year in ultra-glam style. See pic Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's New Year celebrations were nothing short of fashion and glam. Take a look at the picture here.

Aishwarya-Abhishek enjoy a low-key New Year in New York with Aaradhya. See pics Aishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan spent New Year's in New York, opting for a quiet getaway with their daughter Aaradhya. Pictures of the couple posing with a fan from the holiday have emerged online.

Veteran Kannada actor Jaggesh compares piracy to robbery, warns of strict action Calling piracy a serious crime, veteran Kannada actor Jaggesh warned that even sharing illegal links can land people in jail.

Sydney Sweeney's frontal nudity scene among 8 minutes censored from The Housemaid The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has removed over eight minutes of frontal nudity from the film 'The Housemaid', starring Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried, for its Indian release.

I&B ministry orders edits to Dhurandhar, Baloch muted in new theatrical cut: Report Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar, highest-grossing Hindi film of 2025, will release a revised version nationwide from January 2026. The update follows ministry directives to mute certain words and revise dialogues.

general news.headline: Hindu man stabbed, set on fire by mob in Bangladesh. 4th such incident in 2 weeksThe businessman, Khokan Chandra, had a narrow escape after he was beaten, stabbed and set on fire by a mob in Bangladesh. He escaped by jumping into a nearby pond, but sustained serious burn injuries.

40 killed, 100 injured in explosion at Switzerland bar on New Year's EveAt least 40 people were killed in an explosion at a luxury bar in the Swiss ski resort town of Crans-Montana as hundreds gathered for celebrations on New Year's Eve.

As MAGA seethes, Mamdani tries to blunt attacks using Quran with non-Muslim legacyA storm had been brewing since it was revealed that Zohran Mamdani would use a Quran to be sworn in as the Mayor of NYC City. Under attack, Team Mamdani selected a Quran that belonged to Black writer Arturo Schomburg, a non-Muslim, to minimise the damage. The Schomburg Quran was among the three copies of the Islamic holy book used by Mamdani.

The New Year of Harappa: A Story of Earth, Stars, and SurvivalIn 2400 BCE, before clocks or calendars, an entire city held its breath in darkness, waiting for seven stars to signal that time itself would begin again. This is the story of how one culture may have marked their New Year through celestial observation and astronomical precision.

sports.headline: Stefanos Tsitsipas recalls contemplating retirement in 2025: Couldn't walk for two days Stefanos Tsitsipas says a crippling back injury in 2025 left him unable to walk for days and close to retirement, but pain-free rehabilitation has renewed his confidence and focus on staying healthy in 2026.

Chelsea part ways with Enzo Maresca to get their season back on track Chelsea have confirmed the departure of head coach Enzo Maresca, saying both parties felt a change was needed to get the season back on track amid key objectives still in play.

Ravichandran Ashwin warns ODI cricket could face slow death after 2027 World Cup Former India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin expresses concerns about the decline of the One-Day International format, citing the influence of T20 cricket, the dominance of star players, and challenges posed by ICC scheduling.

Todd Murphy on competition with Nathan Lyon: Was never going to keep my place Australian spinner Todd Murphy has a chance of playing the fifth Ashes Test against England with Nathan Lyon ruled out of the series due to a high-grade right hamstring injury.

Vladimir Kramnik sues FIDE for defamation after Daniel Naroditsky controversy Former world chess champion Vladimir Kramnik has initiated legal proceedings against FIDE, the world chess governing body, in a Swiss court, following an ethics inquiry into his allegations of cheating among top players after the death of American Grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky.

Mitchell Marsh sends strong warning before T20 World Cup with 58-ball century in BBL Mitchell Marsh blasted a career-fastest T20 century of 102 off 58 balls for the Perth Scorchers against Hobart Hurricanes in the BBL and sent a warning ahead of the T20 World Cup.

Not upset over IPL snub, Chetan Sakariya focusses on small goals for comeback Indian fast bowler Chetan Sakariya, undeterred by going unsold in the IPL 2026 auction last month and recent domestic struggles, has set small goals to stage a comeback.

Australia name unchanged squad for fifth Ashes Test in Sydney Australia have named an unchanged 15-member squad for the fifth and final Ashes Test against England, with Steve Smith continuing as captain in Pat Cummins' absence. The fifth Test begins on January 4 at Sydney Cricket Ground.

Babar Azam welcomes 2026 with match-winning 58, Mohammad Rizwan fails again BBL 2025-26: Babar Azam's unbeaten 58 steered Sydney Sixers to a six-wicket win over Melbourne Renegades at the Docklands Stadium, while Mohammad Rizwan struggled again in the Big Bash League.

Sarfaraz can play all 3 formats, a shame that he's being ignored: Former captain Former India captain Dilip Vengsarkar believes Sarfaraz Khan deserves a place in all formats of the Indian team. After WPL exit, Ellyse Perry shines with match-winning effort in New Zealand Australia legend Ellyse Perry made an immediate impact after withdrawing from WPL 2026, starring with a key all-round performance to lead Wellington Women to a dominant win in the Women's Super Smash.

England need to win in Sydney for Stokes and McCullum's future: Michael VaughanMichael Vaughan feels England need to win the fifth Test of the ongoing Ashes 2025-26 for Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum to continue in their respective roles. England are trailing by 1-3 in the five-match series with one game remaining.

MS Dhoni to Cristiano Ronaldo: Some of the greatest athletes could retire in 2026There are men who play sport and there are men who shape it. This year, a significant crop of those trendsetting players could call time on their respective careers.

Chaos at Chelsea: Coach Enzo Maresca likely to leave after fallout with clubChelsea are bracing for another managerial change as tensions with Enzo Maresca reach breaking point. Poor results, internal friction and growing uncertainty have pushed both sides towards an imminent parting of ways.

Mandhana seeks blessings at Mahakaleshwar temple with team India to start 2026Smriti Mandhana visited the Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain to offer prayers and attend the Bhasm Aarti on the first day of 2026 along with the Indian women's cricket team.

From Vaibhav Suryavanshi to Divya Deshmukh: 10 next-gen stars to watch out for in 20262025 saw Vaibhav Suryavanshi, Divya Deshmukh, and many young athletes break records and claim titles, setting the stage for a thrilling 2026 and proving they are built for greatness.

CSK and MI combo wreak havoc in SA20: Brevis, Rutherford smash 6 sixes in a rowDewald Brevis and Sherfane Rutherford lit up the SA20 with a brutal finishing act for Pretoria Capitals. Their six-sixes blitz powered a massive win and marked Brevis' return to form.

January transfer window: A lifeline for out-of-favour players' World Cup dreamsWith the January transfer window opening on January 1, it represents a last chance for some players to revive their World Cup hopes. With the 2026 tournament now only months away, a growing number of footballers will view January as a crucial turning point. From established internationals to emerging talents, the window can offer a lifeline for those who have slipped out of favour at their current clubs.

Khawaja should retire on his terms at homeground in Sydney: Michael VaughanMichael Vaughan has suggested that Usman Khawaja should retire on his own terms during the upcoming fifth Ashes Test in Sydney. Khawaja has been struggling with form since 2024 and injuries have also troubled him during the ongoing series.

India cricket schedule 2026: 3 World Cups and major tours in a busy yearIndian cricket in 2026: With three World Cups in play, the men's and women's teams face a busy, white-ball-heavy year that could shape careers and deliver defining moments.

Australia name spin-heavy squad for T20 World Cup, Cummins picked despite injuryAustralia have announced a 15-member spin-heavy squad for the T20 World Cup 2026, set to begin on February 7. Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood and Tim David have been named despite injuries.

A year like no other: 2026 packed with major sports eventsIt's going to be a jam-packed year of sports in 2026 with the FIFA World Cup taking centre stage. Along with this, the cricket fans will get to see the Indian men's and women's teams in action in two T20 World Cups. Here's a look at the entire sports calendar for the new year.

Improve your body language: Gus Atkinson given advice by Broad after poor AshesEngland legend Stuart Broad said that Gus Atkinson needs to improve on his body language after a flat performance during the Ashes series in Australia. Atkinson failed to impress for the visitors in the three matches he played.

Roberto Carlos undergoes immediate surgery after heart problem detectedFormer Brazil and Real Madrid defender Roberto Carlos underwent heart surgery in Brazil after a medical test revealed a heart dysfunction. The procedure lasted nearly three hours due to complications, but Carlos reports he is now recovering and under medical observation.

Virat Kohli steps into New Year with light of his life Anushka Sharma, says bye to 2025Virat Kohli rang in 2026 by sharing a joyful masked moment with his wife Anushka Sharma, calling her the light of his life as he bid goodbye to 2025. Kohli recently played in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, returning to play the List A tournament after 15 years.

Zimbabwe star Sikandar Raza suffers personal tragedy as young brother dies at 13Zimbabwe's T20I captain Sikandar Raza has suffered a personal tragedy as his younger brother Muhammad Mahdi passed away at the age of 13.

Babar vs Rizwan: When and where to watch Pakistan stars in BBL on New Year's DayBBL 2025-26: Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan will be in action on New Year's Day when Sydney Sixers and Melbourne Renegades lock horns at the Docklands Stadium in Melbourne.

WPL 2026: Lizelle Lee, Marizanne Kapp start training with Delhi Capitals in GoaVeteran South Africa all-rounder Marizanne Kapp, along with compatriot Lizelle Lee, who played a key role in Hobart's recent WBBL title triumph, has joined the Delhi Capitals training session ahead of the upcoming Women's Premier League.

After Sarfaraz Khan Vijay Hazare blitz, Ashwin wants Mumbai star as CSK regularR Ashwin has backed Sarfaraz Khan to be a regular for CSK in their starting XII for the upcoming IPL season. Sarfaraz has been in scintillating form in domestic white-ball cricket for Mumbai this year.

Vijay Hazare Trophy: Rishabh Pant struggles for impact amid chatter of ODI snubVijay Hazare Trophy: Delhi lost their first game in the Vijay Hazare Trophy after Rishabh Pant-led Delhi fell to Odisha on Wednesday, December 31. Pant continued to have a poor time in the competition amidst murmurs of a drop from the ODI squad.

Indian football federation asks ISL clubs to confirm participation amid delayThe AIFF on Wednesday asked ISL clubs to confirm their participation and preferred format for the delayed season within a day to inform the continental body of the match count.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
